subsc: Health,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector,Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance,Central government administration,General education sector
trustfund:
TF021845-REFORMS IN THE BOLIVIAN PENSION SYSTEM,TF021403-PHRD-CAPITALIZATION PROGRAM
            ADJ. CREDIT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of this project is
            highly satisfactory. Some of the key lessons include: 1)
            Ownership and commitment are essential for the success of a
            reform program. 2) The feedback of a public information
            campaign needs to be included in the design of the program.
            3) The sustainability of the reform is greatly enhanced by
            putting emphasis on the transparency of the transactions and
            by putting in place a worker's share program that
            provides a strong constituency for the reform. 4)
            Privatization through capitalization provides a good
            alternative in scenarios where direct privatization is not
            feasible or costly in terms of process or political capital.
            5) In privatization programs, the focus tends to be on the
            efficiency effects of reform. But the programs also have
            important distributional effects. 6) Adjustment operations
            are best designed to end well before elections are due. 7)
            Although adjustment operations are normally designed to be
            fully implemented by a single administration, the leverage
            afforded by such an operation can be put to good use during
            a change of government. 8) It is optimal to have not only
            laws but also regulations and regulators in place before
            proceeding with divestiture transactions. 9) In pension
            reform a more radical approach to reform is not necessarily
            more costly than a gradualist approach. 10) Pension reform
            will take longer than planned. 11) Technical assistance
            through parallel but separate credits allows more flexibility.
